top_comment.text:
Unfortunately there's nothing in Dota 2 that tells new players that they 
should watch guides and learn how to play more than just carries. When I 
first started playing Dota 2 I had the impression that everyone just picked 
a hero and played. The tutorial does nothing to teach some of the most 
important parts of the game: team composition, using teamwork, and adapting 
to the situation. All the time I see people play terribly because they just 
pick whatever hero they want to play as and have no regard for the team and 
when things start going bad they continue to play the same way that gets 
them killed. The tutorial on Dota 2 needs to be reworked. The last hit 
training was a nice step in the right direction, but the tutorial needs to 
teach how to lane, how to pick heroes, how to work with your team, how to 
turn around games, how to adapt to the situation, how to survive and not be 
reckless, and it needs to encourage new players to watch/read guides and 
try to keep learning about the game outside of just playing.﻿
top_comment.author: infamousXsniper055

comments.text:
That's kind of the point of it also being a team game however, with your 
teammates being courteous and teaching you how to play. But that isn't the 
case often, so yeah the tutorial does need to be revamped, I would have 
lost my first 30 matches if it weren't for my friends who taught me and 
online guides.
comments.author: blakeout

comments.text:
That's true. The Dota tutorials are good, but they are incomplete. I 
commend you (Not the Dota commend).

your teammates is destructive to the pursuit of fun.

captions.text: RUBICK: Hello and welcome to another Dota Report thing.

The reporter is dead, our team is terrible
and should stop
playing forever.
Hey Enigma, do you want to abandon?
We should just abandon. Let's abandon.

ENIGMA: Whoa hold up there, you're starting to sound
like me.

RUBICK: It's just so frustrating to play with these
people!

I'm trying my hardest to win these idiots
are blowing it!
ENIGMA: Hey Pudge you did something right for once!
I would recommend uninstalling
Yeah, maybe it is frustrating.

But... that's what we signed up for, didn't
we?

It's a challenging task, this whole 'Dota'
thing

But if there's one thing I've learned through
all of this

it's that yelling at and belittling teammates doesn't
actually
help anyone.

I think that's what Nigel would say if he
were here.
I mean look at our last game.
Pudge was a deadweight piece of shit,
I gave him an earfull,
And then he still played like a giant f***ing bag of dicks.

Without Nigel here I am finally realizing
that maybe we
should change our approach.
I think that we should try to have...
Now stay with me here... fun.
RUBICK: Fun? What's that?

ENIGMA: Fun is when you...fun is...it's like...it's
kinda...

sorta like a...
What is fun?
Let me spell it for you.
F.U.N. Fun.
RUBICK: Oh, okay.
ENIGMA: The others are probably pretty new.

More than ever before this team needs... fun
Rubick!
Do you remember my first black hole ever?
RUBICK: Yes. It went horribly and you didn't hit anyone.

ENIGMA: Exactly! But you were beside me encouraging
me all the way.

I think maybe we can have a good time and maybe even
learn something -
even if we get our faces bashed in.
RUBICK: You're... you're absolutely right!
ENIGMA: Yes I am. Commend me.
RUBICK: Don't ruin it.
Hello, Bristleback!

Let's have a look at your items. What you
got?

BB: Let's see, I have some power treads, a magical
stick, Oh!
And a Vanguard.
RUBICK: Why did you buy that?
BB: Build said to.
RUBICK: Ah. Well, it's a good start.

One suggestion: always carry a town portal
scroll!
Never a bad idea.
And for fights, spam those spells!

Now let's give it ago on that stupid Wisp
that is alone
because of story purposes.
Now!

Nicely done. See how useful your allergies
are?
BB: I'm taller!
RUBICK: Alright, Invoker, what you got?
INVOKER: I've purchased something called Eu.. Eul...
Eul's Scepter of Divinity.
RUBICK: Why did you buy that?
INVOKER: My build said to.

RUBICK: Its active is a tornado that will keep someone
in place.

Perfect for some of your skills that are a
bit wonky to aim,
don't you think?
INVOKER: I suppose that is quite useful.
RUBICK: Look over there, conveniently placed Pudge!
Look! Convenient hook steal!

ENIGMA: Gyrocopter, my man, my dude. How goes the
farming?

GYRO: I've ended the lives of over one hundred of
their soldiers!
Fear me and my drum of endurance!
ENIGMA: Why did you buy that?
GYRO: I f***ing love drumming!
ENIGMA: K.

So you know about your ultimate ability, right?
Call Down?
GYRO: I'm a mass murderer!

ENIGMA: It's a great ability to use in combination
with my ultimate,
Black Hole.
One might call it a wombination combination.
GYRO: Roger that, purple ghost.
Whoa, a more different purple ghost.
ENIGMA: Oh! Oh god! It's happening!
Here we go!
